Cambridgeshire – £325k cut to bookfund this year, with £230k of that reduction returned in 2017.
Cornwall – No library closed despite £2 p.a. cut: due to co-locations and financial support from smaller councils.
Lancashire – Lostock Hall Library to close on 30th November. Coppull and Eccleston will become volunteer and not close.
Leicester – Belgrave Library saved from closure due to public protest and discovery it would not save money to do so.
Inverclyde – £2m refurbishmen to McLean Museum and Watt Library.
Staffordshire – Knutton Library to be volunteer-staffed and managed by local primary school.
East Riding of Yorkshire – Cuts to library budget, including co-locations, confirmed.
Newcastle – To sell/withdraw reference stock to make way for extra room hire space (hope for £110k per year income).
Cumbria – Tourist information centre may move into and staff Cockermouth Library,  with all library staff lost,.
Hertfordshire – £400k refurb of Watford Library includes 3D printer CreatorSpace.
Kent – Dartford Library and Museum co-located in £650k restoration.
Nottingham – Central Library sold to private developer: library either to be retained on site or moved to new location. Sneinton Police Station to be converted into library/community centre.
Vale of Glamorgan – £100k learning suite at Barry Library.
Argyll and Bute – Libraries and other services to transfer to Trust.
Leicester – Syston Library in staffless pilot.
Essex – Writtle Library hours reduced due to post office move (co-location)
Scottish Borders – redundancies offered as cuts expected.
Sheffield – Central Library may be sold to developers.
Suffolk – £240k cut meaning 34% cut in budget since 2010/11.
Edinburgh – Opening hours cuts in many libraries. Co-locations. Budget of Lifelong Learning department to be cut by £6.4m.
Cumbria – Consultation. Opening hours cuts proposed over lunchtimes and Saturdays.
Devon – Libraries Unlimited officially given charitable status.

Redcar and Cleveland – £400k cut. Over 100 hours opening reduced per week in total, with five (Brotton, Dormanstown, Laburnum Road in Redcar, Roseberry in Redcar and Loftus ) down to 14 hours per week, and Roseberry and Loftus moving to new locations. Mobile Library to close.

Swindon – £1.5m cut confirmed. 10 out of 15 branches to close or turn volunteer. One-third of staff (50 posts FTE so many more actual people) to be lost. Park Library, previously threatened, to be retained. £500k to be used to help libraries become unpaid.
